title: Wolf and elk populations in Yellowstone 4

content.question: Which of the following models best predicts the effect on the ecosystem if a deadly communicable disease is introduced into the wolf population?

choices.label: Each figure shows a graph with a solid line representing Wolves and a dashed line representing Elk.  The horizontal axis is labeled Year, and the numbers appearing on it, from left to right, are 2005, 2010, and 2015.  There is one tick mark before 2005, one tick mark after 2015, and one for every year between 2005 and 2015.  The left vertical axis is labeled Wolf Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 20.  The right vertical axis is labeled Elk Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 120. For each graph, there is a horizontal downward pointing arrow right before the year 2008 that is labeled Disease Introduced. Option A. The solid line representing Wolves starts at approximately three-fourths of the way up the vertical axis at 2004 and moves horizontally right until about 2008 where it moves steeply down and to the right, ending at 2015 approximately one-twentieth of the way up the vertical axis.  The dashed line representing Elk starts at approximately one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis and moves gradually up at 2004 before curving gradually down again at 2005.  The line then moves horizontally right until approximately 2009 where it moves gradually up and to the right, ending on the right vertical axis at a point slightly higher than three-fourths.

B: Each figure shows a graph with a solid line representing Wolves and a dashed line representing Elk.  The horizontal axis is labeled Year, and the numbers appearing on it, from left to right, are 2005, 2010, and 2015.  There is one tick mark before 2005, one tick mark after 2015, and one for every year between 2005 and 2015.  The left vertical axis is labeled Wolf Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 20.  The right vertical axis is labeled Elk Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 120. For each graph, there is a horizontal downward pointing arrow right before the year 2008 that is labeled Disease Introduced. Option B. The solid line representing Wolves starts at approximately one-half of the way up the vertical axis at 2004 and moves gradually up and to the right until about 2005 where it moves slightly up and to the right, ending before 2015 and at a point slightly higher than one-half of the way up on the vertical axis.  The dashed line representing Elk starts at approximately one-eighth of the way up the vertical axis at 2004 and curves gradually up and to the right before curving gradually down again at 2014.  The line ends at 2016 slightly higher than one-fourth of the way up on the vertical axis.

C:  Each figure shows a graph with a solid line representing Wolves and a dashed line representing Elk.  The horizontal axis is labeled Year, and the numbers appearing on it, from left to right, are 2005, 2010, and 2015.  There is one tick mark before 2005, one tick mark after 2015, and one for every year between 2005 and 2015.  The left vertical axis is labeled Wolf Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 20.  The right vertical axis is labeled Elk Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 120. For each graph, there is a horizontal downward pointing arrow right before the year 2008 that is labeled Disease Introduced.  Option C. The solid line representing Wolves starts at a point slightly lower than one-half of the way up the vertical axis at 2005 and moves slightly up and to the  right until about 2010 where it moves steeply up and to the right, ending at 2015 at approximately the tick mark labeled 120 along the right vertical axis. The dashed line representing Elk starts at approximately one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis at 2005 and moves slightly up and to the right until about 2010 where it moves steeply down and to the right, ending at 2015 at a point slightly above the horizontal axis.

D:  Each figure shows a graph with a solid line representing Wolves and a dashed line representing Elk.  The horizontal axis is labeled Year, and the numbers appearing on it, from left to right, are 2005, 2010, and 2015.  There is one tick mark before 2005, one tick mark after 2015, and one for every year between 2005 and 2015.  The left vertical axis is labeled Wolf Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 20.  The right vertical axis is labeled Elk Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 120. For each graph, there is a horizontal downward pointing arrow right before the year 2008 that is labeled Disease Introduced.  Option D. The solid line representing Wolves starts at approximately one-half of the way up the vertical axis, slightly before 2005, and moves horizontally right until about 2008 where it moves steeply down and to the right, ending at 2015 at a point slightly above the horizontal axis.  The dashed line representing Elk starts at approximately one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis, slightly before 2005, and moves horizontally right until about 2008 where it moves steeply down and to the right, becoming horizontal as it approaches the horizontal axis, ending slightly before 2015 at a point slightly above the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Each figure shows a graph with a solid line representing Wolves and a dashed line representing Elk.  The horizontal axis is labeled Year, and the numbers appearing on it, from left to right, are 2005, 2010, and 2015.  There is one tick mark before 2005, one tick mark after 2015, and one for every year between 2005 and 2015.  The left vertical axis is labeled Wolf Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 20.  The right vertical axis is labeled Elk Population and has one tick mark on the top end labeled 120. For each graph, there is a horizontal downward pointing arrow right before the year 2008 that is labeled Disease Introduced. Option A. The solid line representing Wolves starts at approximately three-fourths of the way up the vertical axis at 2004 and moves horizontally right until about 2008 where it moves steeply down and to the right, ending at 2015 approximately one-twentieth of the way up the vertical axis.  The dashed line representing Elk starts at approximately one-fourth of the way up the vertical axis and moves gradually up at 2004 before curving gradually down again at 2005.  The line then moves horizontally right until approximately 2009 where it moves gradually up and to the right, ending on the right vertical axis at a point slightly higher than three-fourths.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
